level.text: Subject to § 29-1204.03, in exercising the powers of trusteeship, a trustee shall act in good faith and in a manner the trustee reasonably believes to be in the best interests of the statutory trust.
A trustee shall discharge its duties with the care that a person in a similar position would reasonably believe appropriate under similar circumstances.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 29-1201.04, § 29-1205.09, and § 29-1206.16.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-378
level.text: For history of Law 18-378, see notes under § 29-101.01.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 505 of the Uniform Statutory Trust Entity Act.
